args:
During the reign of King Aurelius

The Kingdom of Alberia
Sol Alberia—New Town

...I'm afraid that's impossible. With the
situation as it is, there's essentially no
chance of saving every single resident of
Old Town.
It's vexing to say this, but Harle is right.\nSometimes hard decisions must be made\nfor the sake of justice.
So you're telling me to judge which lives\ntake precedence?
Of course. Does something about that\nstrike you as odd?
(I know the logic behind their words is\ncorrect, yet I cannot agree to it.)
(Because my ideal is to help all the people\nof Alberia, no matter the personal cost.)
You called for me, Your Highness?
I did, Lief. Thanks for coming. And sorry to\njump right into things, but are you aware\nof the recent spate of bomb threats?

I am, Highness. I received multiple reports
from my subordinates regarding threats
made to areas near the Halidom, and the
town of Palena in particular.

But as of right now, the threats are just
that—no one has been hurt, and no
demands have been made. Many feel this
person simply enjoys creating terror.
Still, they may not be content with threats\nforever. I want security tightened up across\nthe kingdom for now.
And I'd also like you to look into this\naffair personally.
Then you would have me investigate the\nmatter rather than command our security\noperations?

You were part of the team that dealt with
the incident in the old capital, right?
I think that experience will prove useful
in this situation.

I will work alone so as not to provoke our
unseen agitator. I will also shed my armor
and conduct my investigation in light
civilian garb to avoid undue attention.
Thanks, Lief. We're all counting on you.
(Right then. Time to get to work gathering\ninformation. I'll start by finding locals who\nknow about the situation.)
I'm sorry, do we know each other?
I'm Callan! You helped me after the\nincident in Old Town all those years ago.
Ah, I see! Perchance were you at the\nsupport center for victims of the bombing?
Yes, I was one of the orphans. You helped\nme more than you know back then.
I merely did what I could. I pray life finds\nyou well now?
Yes, thanks to the people of town. I'm now\nan assistant working at this assembly hall.
Then we are well met indeed, Callan,\nfor I have come to this place to investigate\nthe recent bomb threats.
Might I ask you to share what you know?\nYou may be in possession of some clue\nwithout even knowing its significance.
Of course! I'm happy to help!
Honestly, it's a huge relief to know you're\nhere investigating things. I've been on pins\nand needles since those threats started.
I can't help but think about how my parents\ndied in the bombings back then.
You have been brave in the face of painful\nmemories, but I will see that all is put to\nrights—I swear it.

The crown and its people are the twin
jewels which make up a kingdom.
And as a knight who serves that kingdom,
it is my duty to protect them all.
So I swear to you again—I will see this\nlatest incident resolved with all speed!
It is merely my duty as a knight. Now,\nsince the issuance of the threats, have\nthere been any changes of note in town?

Well, folks have definitely been a lot
more cautious. And just this morning
there was a threat on the main street
that evacuated all the shopkeepers.
Some of our leaders are actually calling\nfor us to evacuate the town entirely.
Thank you for this most useful information.\nI must now away to investigate that street.
Evacuation? More like abandonment.\nIt seems the ghosts of ten years ago are\nrearing their ugly heads.
I must find a clue to resolving this matter\nas quickly as I can.
Hmm? What's that light on the corner?
(Fascinating... It's a magical instrument\nthat automatically casts fire magic after\na set amount of time has passed.)

(If this is the work of our mysterious threat
issuer, it seems they are no longer content
to merely bask in the terror caused by their
malodorous pronouncements.)
I must be rid of this device before it goes\noff and damages every nearby building.
Hey, mister! Have you seen my ball?
(Fie, a child! How did he get in here?!)
Leave this place at once, lad! It isn't safe!
But I gotta find my baaaaall!
A ball can be replaced; a life cannot!\nListen to me and hurry away—
No time for talk, lad! RUN!
Damnation! It went off! Thankfully the boy\nand I managed to escape, but the town...
(Still, the modus operandi of that device\nseems familiar to me.)
(If I'm right, this is a remote bombing\ncarried out by way of a prohibited\nmagical device...)
(Which is exactly like the incident carried\nout by the anti-monarchy faction in\nOld Town all those years ago!)
